DOC.brief_summary: Many critically ill newborn neonatal intensive care ( NICU ) critical care unit ( NCCU ) environment develop feed movement problem . The purpose study determine extent neurophysiologically base occupational therapy intervention ( NBOTI ) NCCU infant would affect intervention group 's oral feeding covariates , heart rate variability ( HRV ) feeding . The biopsychosocial model provide study 's conceptual framework . The key research question explore whether NBOTI NCCU promote healthy infant development feeding , movement organization , parent self-efficacy . This exploratory study 10 NCCU infant 10 historical match control utilized mixed method design qualitatively cod video analysis inferential statistic test , binomial test , hierarchal linear modeling ( HLM ) , multivariate analysis . Significant difference obtain intervention comparison group number day tube oral feeding discharge speed infant gain weight . Longitudinal analysis intervention group data employ reveal significant trend pre/post difference HRV data along quickly infant ate , parent perception self efficacy decreased stress NCCU . Finally , qualitative finding obtain videotape analysis provide evidence NBOTI effective facilitate feed promote development . The recommendation replicate study validate expand finding current study . The model infant care suggest finding could contribute positive social change foster positive physical emotional child development healthy child-parent family-caregiver relationship .

DOC.detailed_description: Cerebral palsy ( CP ) common physical disability childhood ( Surveillance Cerebral Palsy Europe [ SCPE ] , 2000 , 2002 ; Winter , Autry , Boyle , & Yeargin-Allsopp , 2002 ) , epidemiological study industrialize country indicate CP occur 2.0 2.5 per 1000 live birth ( Hagberg , Hagberg , Beckung , & Uvebrant , 2001 ; Paneth & Kiely , 1984 ; Parkes , Dolk , Hill , & Pattenden , 2001 ) . CP define movement impairment range mild severe ( Bax et al. , 2005 ; Bobath , 1954 ; Nelson , 2001 ) ; occur social , physical environmental causal pathway result brain lesion sometime ante , peri post natal period birth ( Stanley , Blair , & Alberman , 2000 ) . Preterm birth account 40 % case cerebral palsy ( Stanley et al. , 2000 ) . An infant born preterm birth occur 17-36 week date conception . Per 1,000 birth United States 1989 1996 , rate preterm birth increase 4 % , African American preterm birth nearly twice white ( Morbidity Mortality Weekly Report [ MMWR ] , 1999 ) . The rate preterm birth United States 10 % birth . Early born preterm infant need organ support neonatal intensive care unit ( NICU ) nursery . Problems encountered population due undeveloped system consist respiratory , cardiac , central nervous system ( CNS ) vulnerability damage , feed gastrointestinal , kidney problem ( Goldenring , 2004 ) . Norm reference cognitive , social , neuro-developmental test score 6 year age indicate 80 % extremely preterm infant exhibit mild , moderate , severe sensorimotor ( perceptual-cognitive-motor ) disability ; 12 % infant diagnose disable CP ( Marlow , Wolke , Bracewell , & Samara , 2005 ) . These discrepancy efficient process sensorimotor stimulation continue childhood ( DeMaio-Feldman , 1994 ; Feder , et al . 2005 ) measure child 's cognitive response environment ( Barlow & Lewandowski , 2000 ) , internally mechanisms provide foundation equilibrium perception information generate within joint , muscle , skin tactile-kinesthetic information ( Bracewell & Marlow,2002 ; de Groot , van Hoek , Hopkins , & Touwen , 1993 ) , auditory , vestibular , visual postural-spatial processing ( de Graaf , Samsom , Pettersen , Schaaf , van Schie , & de Groot , 2004 ; De Vries , & De Groot , 2002 ) . In addition factor low birth weight predispose infant central nervous system insult ( 40 % ) , remain 60 % infant diagnose CP suffer acute insult CNS ( hemorrhage , increase intracranial pressure , hypoxic ischemic injury ) reason , respiratory disease , sepsis , necrotizing enterocolitis neonate ( NEC ) . Many different factor , endogenous mediator mechanism , mechanical , alter vascular pressure . One respiratory condition pre , near , term age infant result composite neuro-developmental audiologic impairment ( motor , cognitive , perceptual , behavioral ) , range 15-50 % , persistent pulmonary hypertension newborn ( PPHN ) ( Lipkin , Davidson , Rhines , & Chang , 2002 ; Lipkin , Davidson , Rhines , & Chang , 2002 ) . As respiratory disease process , PPHN result pulmonary hypoplasia associate diaphragmatic , less degree abdominal wall hernia , vasoconstriction associate bacterial sepsis , addition pathophysiology ( Hagedorn , Gardner , Dickey , & Abman , 2006 ) .
